To determine the effect of decreasing prevalence on the positive predictive value (PPV) and negative predictive value (NPV) of the diagnostic test, we need to understand the definitions and calculations of these values.

Positive Predictive Value (PPV) is the proportion of true positives among all positive test results. It is calculated as:
PPV = (True Positives / (True Positives + False Positives))

Negative Predictive Value (NPV) is the proportion of true negatives among all negative test results. It is calculated as:
NPV = (True Negatives / (True Negatives + False Negatives))
